result.execSummary:
The defendant Mickail Sean Batchelor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by applying cash bail on deposit, remaining balance to be returned to person who posted.   
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample; Court WAIVES surcharges as defendant is already paying surcharges on 15CF881.

Consecutive to: To 15CF881. The first 60 days straight time, remaining 5 months with release to the Day Reporting Center.  Court allows for good time credit. Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on April 28, 2016 by 5:00 p.m. Court does not revoke defendant's driving privileges

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Bail assignment
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Mickail Sean Batchelor in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statement made by Quintin B.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, the first 60 days straight time, remaining 5 months with release to the Day Reporting Center, consecutive with 15CF881.  Court allows for good time credit.  

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by applying cash bail on deposit, remaining balance to be returned to person who posted.   
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample; Court WAIVES surcharges as defendant is already paying surcharges on 15CF881.  
-Court does not revoke defendant's driving privileges  
-Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on April 28, 2016 by 5:00 p.m.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Sentencing Referral Form
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Mickail Sean Batchelor in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussions held off the record.  Parties request an adjournment of the sentencing hearing.  Matter rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mickail Sean Batchelor in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
BAIL ASSIGNMENT.

Defendant Mickail Sean Batchelor in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mickail Sean Batchelor in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jacob Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. JusticePoint to continue monitoring until further notice to the court.

Defendant Mickail Sean Batchelor in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time as negotiations are still on going.  Parties request that the defendant be under the supervision of Justice Point. Court ordered the defendant turned over to Justice Point for supervision.  No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no firearms or dangerous weapons. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant has been discharged.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court.  Irene Parthum for Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Defendant failing to appear.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mickail Sean Batchelor in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests global plea and sentencing date with case# 15CF881.  Branch 22 agrees to take this case for the purpose of global resolution.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mickail Sean Batchelor in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Jay Pucek for Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Burch-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/3/15.
